content: p1 ribbing work then in stockinette stitch until the hat measures 6 ¾ / 17 cm from the cast-on round place markers for crown decreases k28 pm 3 times k28 slip bor marker work decrease round * k1 k2tog knit to 3 sts before the next marker ssk k1 sm repeat from * to end = 8 sts decreased 104 sts remain repeat decrease round on every 2nd round until 56 sts remain knitting the in-between rounds repeat decrease round then on every round until 24 sts remain you can now remove all other markers except the bor marker next round * k1 k2tog ssk k1 repeat from * to end = 16 sts remain next round repeat k2tog ssk to end = 8 sts remain break yarn leaving a 10 / 25 cm tail place it on the tapestry needle and thread through the remaining stitches tighten to close the gap weave in the yarn ends on wrong side of work inner hat hold the outer hat right side facing you and cast-on round pointing up pick up and knit 112 sts from the cast-on round of the outer hat place the bor marker and continue working in the round work the inner hat in the same manner as you worked the outer hat weave in all the yarn ends that you have before starting the crown decreases when the inner hat is finished close the gap as you did for the outer hat and weave in the final yarn ends on right side of work finishing place the hat in lukewarm water and let it soak thoroughly gently squeeze out the excess water place the hat on a towel and roll in to remove further moisture lay on a flat surface stretching the ribbing a bit for more even look and let dry completely tug the inner hat inside the outer hat 3 copyright suviknits 2025
